summary: coronaviruses are members of the order Nidovirales and family Coronaviridae which are made up of single-stranded positive sense RNA genomes. they are divided into four genera namely Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, Gammacoronavirus, and Deltacoronavirus. in 2003, a coronavirus belonging to the Alphacoronavirus genus was discovered in an infant in the Netherlands. HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have no known intermediate mammalian hosts. coronavirus NL63 is known to use the same receptor as SARS-CoV. this assertion is yet to be explored through surveillance data. HCoV-NL63-rIFA-tested human samples tested positive by immunofluorescence testing. the optical density values ranged from 0.0 to 0.32 for sheep, 0.02 to 0.68 for goats, and 0.04 to 0.74 for swine. the recombinant immunofluorescence assay described in this study is a robust, sensitive, and specific assay. the assay is a robust, sensitive, and specific assay, but is not suitable for use on a large scale. lack of cross-reactivity between HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-OC43 has been reported by other studies that employed recombinant ELISAs targeting the nucleocapsid protein. despite the fact discrimination was possible in the present study using the whole virus antigen, some degree of cross-reactivity was also observed. the nucleocapsid protein is produced abundantly during infection. it is employed in assay development because it is a potent immunogen. the membrane protein is more abundant in the complete virion particle than nucleocapsid protein. human coronavirus NL63 uses angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) 2 receptor for infection of target cells similar to SARS-CoV [20] and has been found to be able to replicate in swine cells in vitro. there have not been any reports of HCoV-NL63-related viruses circulating in Ghanaian bats. recombination events between canine coronavirus and transmissible gastroenteritis virus and canine coronavirus and feline coronavirus have brought about new coronaviruses. these new viruses may have a different host range especially if changes occur in the spike region or different pathology in the same host.
